item.description:
The Boston chapter of the Search Engine Marketing Professionals Organization (SEMPO, http://www.sempo.org...) is holding its first meeting for search and marketing professionals in the greater Boston Area September 24, 2008 at Bentley College, Waltham, MA from 6:30 to 9:00 PM.

Local search and marketing experts headline the panel discussion, “No More Silos: Search and Marketing Must Sit at the Same Table.” During this interactive discussion, search and marketing professionals will learn how to break down the walls or silos between the “technical” and “marketing” sides of search marketing in order to learn that they are in fact working toward the same end – to improve a company’s bottom line.

Panel members include Jim Griffeth, President of Boston SEO firm Stratimind, Craig Blake, VP Sales for W.A. Wilde and Past President of the New England Direct Marketing, and Myles Bristowe, Founder of VividContext and President of the Boston American Marketing Association.
item.how_to_find_us: There will be a welcome table when you enter the Center for Marketing Technology
item.name: No More Silos: Search and Marketing Must Sit at the Same Table
